sentences.english: The judge played bridge in the lodge with the budgeter last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚法官和預算員在門房裏打過橋牌。

sentences.english: It's bridge club day. Every fourth Wednesday a the month.
sentences.chinese: 每個月的第四個禮拜三是她們的橋牌聚會日。

sentences.english: They will organize a Bridge Club.
sentences.chinese: 他們將組建一個橋牌俱樂部。

sentences.english: Modern bridge known as contract bridge.
sentences.chinese: 現代橋牌稱爲定約橋牌。

sentences.english: Modern bridge known as contract bridge.
sentences.chinese: 現代橋牌稱爲定約橋牌。

sentences.english: At the beginning of the bridge tournament, we were the under dogs and nobody thought we were going to win.
sentences.chinese: 橋牌賽一開始，我們不被看好，沒有人認爲我們會贏。

sentences.english: He was quite a remarkable player.
sentences.chinese: 他是個相當出色的橋牌手。

sentences.english: The game was "terrible, " Buffett recalls. "Humiliating, " says Osberg.
sentences.chinese: 巴菲特回憶說，那場橋牌打得糟糕透頂。

sentences.english: Gates is an avid reader, and enjoys playing golf, tennis and bridge.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨是一個讀書迷，而且很喜歡打高爾夫和橋牌。

sentences.english: Bridge is the intellective contend of 4 people, play bridge must have partner and opponent.
sentences.chinese: 橋牌是4個人的智力角逐，打橋牌必須有搭檔和對手。

sentences.english: Bridge is the intellective contend of 4 people, play bridge must have partner and opponent.
sentences.chinese: 橋牌是4個人的智力角逐，打橋牌必須有搭檔和對手。

sentences.english: John or Alice at the differerent bridge tcapable is unimaginecapable.
sentences.chinese: 約翰和愛麗斯在同一張橋牌桌上玩真是不可思議。

sentences.english: As promised, we will share the bridge game tally sheet with you in three days.
sentences.chinese: 我們會在三天之內按照承諾，公佈橋牌比賽的計分表。

sentences.english: She cast a sly glance at her bridge partner.
sentences.chinese: 她向橋牌搭擋使了個會意的眼色。

sentences.english: They recreate themselves with playing bridge.

definition: to fail to grasp the main points
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
